title: Is there any good script out there?
content:
I need a well designed script for plaque making. It has to be legible yet appeasing to the untrained eye. I never work with scripts so I hated them all. Now I have to work with them in plaque making. thanks. I have a blog entry about this as well.

Chase

 [‹ Help with this font, Please!](http://web.archive.org/web/20071129212411/http:/typophile.com/node/39488 "Go to previous forum topic") [Bad Fonts Used Well ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20071129212411/http:/typophile.com/node/39353 "Go to next forum topic")
author: Chasography

comments.content: It depends, but maybe [Chocolate](http://web.archive.org/web/20071129212411/http:/www.sudtipos.com/fonts/3) is robust enough for that purpose?

You might like to look at:

[http://www.faces.co.uk/fonts/Berthold/Poppl-Residenz-BE-BE280254/](http://web.archive.org/web/20071129212411/http:/www.faces.co.uk/fonts/Berthold/Poppl-Residenz-BE-BE280254/ "http://www.faces.co.uk/fonts/Berthold/Poppl-Residenz-BE-BE280254/")

just stroll around sudtipos, to begin with, i’d be damned if you don’t find what you need there.

dr

Chocolate is nice, Feel Script is nice as well.

Chase Langdon
